intro: Gaertnera parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered gaertnera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Gaertnera parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
